group_1.narration: ―Chizuru―@You must already know this, but Gen'un@of Suitoku is practically a Demon himself.

group_1.textCenter: We've had a lot of rats scurrying around@here lately.
I did away with one tonight.

group_1.narration: ―Chizuru―@But Gen'un isn't the only bad guy here.
―Tsuyu―@I thought he was just hellbent on@destroying Taito at any cost…?
―Chizuru―@They're going to have Governor Sumiya killed in this battle.

group_1.textLeft: Kumai can't possibly mean to depose him...!
But why would Gen'un join them…?

group_1.textRight: For him, the death of the Taito…has been@his people's dearest wish for centuries…
What's more, if Taito falls, the temple will@receive part of our land…

group_1.narration: "Maybe those two orchestrated the death@of the previous lord of Sumiya."
"Now that the new lord is a foolish young man,@they're free to do as they please…"
"First off, Gen'un and Lord Kumai never@actually told Lord Sumiya about the plight@caused by the famine so that he would@screw things up."
"Because of that, Gen'un was able to win@the people's trust through his debt forgiveness,@while Sumiya was made a mockery of by all."

group_1.textLeft: It seems there is no dispute regarding@the Sumiya Clan's heir.
Unlike his predecessor, a man of cunning who@feared being preyed upon in these chaotic times,
the new lord is a witless coward.

group_1.textRight: In the end, the moratorium@didn't come to pass...

group_1.textLeft: I had some hope he would have the decency@to allow us to take up such measures…
As for the money owed to the temple,@Gen'un said he will take care of it.

group_1.textRight: So the people of Sango...?

group_1.textLeft: They will still owe their debts to@the other lords,
but with their loan to the temple forgiven,@they will be somewhat better off.

group_1.narration: "There must've been some people in the clans@who only wreaked havoc because they@couldn't go against their liege's commands..."
"All of this came to be because the two@of them were plotting behind the scenes.@The poison they've spread has been@causing all of Soma to decay…"

group_1.textLeft: Though I may be the heir of the Sango Clan,@I am now part of the Sumiya Clan as well.
I am not free like you are.
As servants of the Sumiya Clan,@we must pay tribute.
We told them of our plight and went unheard,@so despite our grief, we must extract this tribute!

group_1.narration: "So while Lord Sumiya and his clan@were having their reputations tarnished,@Kumai received a proposal from Suitoku,@and arranged for Taito to be attacked@under Sumiya's orders."
"By making him responsible, Sumiya's value@was further diminished, with the effect of@weakening the other territories as well."

group_1.textRight: Huh…?

group_1.textLeft: Hey, what's…?

group_1.textRight: Corpses…as far as the eye can see…@And blood…everywhere…

group_1.textLeft: Hello? Are any of you still alive?!
I hope someday we'll join up and restore@our country to as it once was.

group_1.textRight: But why not now…?!
We carried out an invasion during a famine,@and the territories are now exhausted.
If we and Taito were to ally with each other,@we would be branded as traitors…

group_1.narration: "With all the pieces in place,@Kumai's final stage of preparation was@to gather up people in his castle to protect@the clans from the Taito Gang."

group_1.textRight: That reminds me, I heard that the Kumai have@pledged to protect the clans from the Taito.
Apparently, people from all over are being@sheltered and hidden away in Mizuna Castle.

group_1.textLeft: Are they really?

group_1.textRight: Outsiders and Battle Shamanesses@weren't included.

group_1.narration: "Now we're in a situation where@if anyone betrays Kumai,@their entire families will be slaughtered."
"Lord Sumiya lacks an heir, so once he's killed,@Lord Kumai, who has a daughter and@a son who can inherit, will jump right@into position as the ruler of Soma."

group_1.textLeft: And Lord Sumiya will be killed…in this second@attack on Taito?

group_1.textRight: Have I convinced you…?

group_1.textLeft: It all makes sense. Sumiya's credibility is so low@that he's a figurehead in all but name.
And then out of nowhere, Lord Kumai sprung@up and started driving…everything…

group_1.textRight: He's turning everything upside down.
It's like a farmer tilling new soil.

group_1.textLeft: And Gen'un was consumed by greed for land@and his ambition to exterminate Taito...
*Sigh*
But now that we know the truth,@we can fix this.

group_1.textRight: Can you let everyone know right away?

group_1.textLeft: That…yes, I can.

group_1.textRight: Then I leave that to you.@EVERYTHING depends on you.

group_1.textLeft: Sana!

group_1.textRight: There you are, Princess!
Oh, I have terrible news…!@Tsuruno was taken captive in Taito Village…
Right now, Chizuru's father has her@with him in the fort!

group_1.textLeft: In that case, can you bring Chizuru back@to the village with you?

group_1.textRight: Erm…Chizuru…?

group_1.textLeft: Sorry for worrying you.

group_1.textRight: Oh, of course…!@Are you alright…?!

group_1.textLeft: I'll explain things along the way. For now,@though, just know that Tsuyu saved me,
and I got all the secret info on Gen'un@and Lord Kumai's plans.
Even if we went to tell the Taito Gang,@there are many soldiers to get through, yes?
That's why I need you to use your power@to vanish so you can pass through.
Sorry for making you run back and forth@like this, but can you help us?

group_1.textRight: If that's the case, leave it to me…!
Alright then, Tsuyu.
I'm counting on you to contact all the clans,@except Kumai and Sumiya, of course!

group_1.textLeft: Yes, I'll let everyone know posthaste!
